# Introduction
Photosynthesis is the fundamental process in the biosphere. 

*Prochlorococcus*:
<p class="forceBreak"></p>
- Photosynthetic unicellular cyanobacterium 
- Important in global carbon cycling
- Contributes significantly to primary production in the open oceans. 
- Strains occupy a wide range of habitats.
- With climate change, ocean warming and lower nutrients,    Prochlorococcus is expected to benefit, increasing its distribution and global abundance.

We use:
<p class="forceBreak"></p>
- Bioptical measures of growth and photosynthesis
- Bioinformatics analysis of strain capacities

## Objectives

1. Determine whether the cells are constitutively able to accomodate changes in oxygen, or whether they acclimate over a period of time to different levels of oxygen.
2. Investigate photosynthetic strategies of *Prochlorococcus* strains.
3. To provide insights into the ecological niches of *Prochlorococcus* strains.

# Methods

**Bioptical Analysis of Growth Rates**
<p class="forceBreak"></p>
Three strains of Prochlorococcus, MED4, MIT9313, SS120
Multi-Cultivator monitors OD680 (Chlorophyll and scattering) and OD720 (cell scattering)
<p class="forceBreak"></p>
Applies combinations:
<p class="forceBreak"></p>
- Dissolved O2
  - 230-280 uM (full O2)
  - 25-50 uM (intermediate O2) 
  - 0.5-5.0 uM (low O2) 
<p class="forceBreak"></p>
- Photoperiod 
<p class="forceBreak"></p>
  - 12 h
<p class="forceBreak"></p>
- Light level 
<p class="forceBreak"></p>
  - 30 µmol photons m-2 s-1
  - 90 µmol photons m-2 s-1
  - 180 µmol photons m-2 s-1
<p class="forceBreak"></p>
- Waveband 
<p class="forceBreak"></p>
  - 450 ∓ 45 nm (Blue)
  
all at 22°C, to each of 8 separate tubes.

Centrifuged samples and the cell pellets frozen in liquid nitrogen and preserved in an -80 oC freezer. Enables future transcriptomic analyses.

**Bioptical Functional Measurements**
<p class="forceBreak"></p>
- Expose samples to a series of increasing light levels and track a 'light response' curve of photosynthetic function of Photosystem II, using Solisense FRRf  Instrument, at
  - 230-280 uM (full O2)
  - 25-50 uM (intermediate O2) 
  - 0.5-5.0 uM (low O2) 
<p class="forceBreak"></p>
Whole Cell Absorbance Spectra using Olis Spectrophotometer at
  - 230-280 uM (full O2) 
  - 0.5-5.0 uM (low O2) 

Chlorophyll a concentrations determined using the Turner Trilogy on each sample

**Photosystem I Measurements**
<p class="forceBreak"></p>
- Expose samples to a series of increasing light levels and track a 'light response' curve of photosynthetic function of Photosystem I and Photosystem II in parallel, using Dual-PAM-100 Instrument, at
  - 230-280 uM (full O2)
  - 25-50 uM (intermediate O2) 
  - 0.5-5.0 uM (low O2) 

Chlorophyll a concentrations were determined using a Spectrophotometer on each sample
